com.pb.sawdust.util.concurrent

Class DnCRecursiveAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask<java.lang.Void>
      • java.util.concurrent.RecursiveAction
        • com.pb.sawdust.util.concurrent.DnCRecursiveAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void>

    public abstract class DnCRecursiveAction
extends java.util.concurrent.RecursiveAction
    The DnCRecursiveAction provides a framework for "divide-and-conquer" RecursiveActions. A divide-and-conquer action is recursively split in half as seperate actions (within a ForkJoinPool) until some criterion is reached, at which point the sub-actions are executed. The criterion should generally use the static getSurplusQueuedTaskCount() method inherited from the RecursiveTask class.

    In order to work correctly, the two constructors in this class must be used in a specific manner. The constructor taking two long arguments is intended for use as the (super) constructor of the instance passed to the ForkJoinPool. The other constructor should be invoked (through super calls) in the implementation of the getNextAction(long, long, DnCRecursiveAction) method.

    To make this more concrete, the following presents an example implementation for an action which takes an array of doubles and replaces it with the squares of the array values. 

    
     public class ArraySquarer extends DnCRecursiveAction {
         private final double[] array;

         public ArraySquarer(double[] array) {
             super(0,array.length);
             this.array = array;
         }

         private ArraySquarer(double[] array, long start, long length, DnCRecursiveAction next) {
             super(start,length,next);
             this.array = array;
         }

         protected void computeAction(long start, long length) {
             long end = start + length;
             for (long i = start; i < end; i++)
                 array[i] = array[i]*array[i];
         }

         protected DnCRecursiveAction getNextAction(long start, long length, DnCRecursiveAction next) {
             return new ArraySquarer(array,start,length,next);
         }

         protected boolean continueDividing(long newLength) {
             return getSurplusQueuedTaskCount() < 3;
         }
     }

      • DnCRecursiveAction

        protected DnCRecursiveAction(long start,
                  long length,
                  DnCRecursiveAction next)
        Conatructor for sub-actions. This should be called for constructing the object returned by getNextAction(long, long, DnCRecursiveAction).
        Parameters:
        start - The starting point of the action.
        length - The length of the action.
        next - The next action.

      • computeAction

        protected abstract void computeAction(long start,
                 long length)
        Compute the action. This method should perform whatever tasks are needed for the points on [start,start+length).
        Parameters:
        start - The starting point of the action.
        length - The length of the action.

      • getNextAction

        protected abstract DnCRecursiveAction getNextAction(long start,
                               long length,
                               DnCRecursiveAction next)
        Get the next (sub-)action resulting from a division. This method should return an instance of the subclass which uses the DnCRecursiveAction(long, long, DnCRecursiveAction) constructor as its super.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting point of the action.
        length - The length of the action.
        next - The next action.
        Returns:
        the next sub-action.

      • continueDividing

        protected abstract boolean continueDividing(long length)
        Determine whether the action should continue to divide or, instead, perform its computations. This method should, at least, make use of the static getSurplusQueuedTaskCount() method inherited from the RecursiveTask class, the result of which should generally be kept above 3 to maintain high concurrency.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the action.
        Returns:
        true if it should continue dividing, false if it should perform its computations.

      • compute

        protected void compute()
        Specified by:
        compute in class java.util.concurrent.RecursiveAction

      • getResult

        public java.lang.Void getResult()
        This method is the same as get(), except it wraps the declared exceptions in runtime exceptions.
        Returns:
        the result of get().
        Throws:
        RuntimeInterruptedException - in place of InterruptedException.
        RuntimeWrappingException - wrapping a thrown ExecutionException.

      • getResult

        public java.lang.Void getResult(long timeout,
                       java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        This method is the same as get(long,TimeUnit), except it wraps the declared exceptions in runtime exceptions.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The length of time to wait for the method to return.
        timeUnit - The units for timeout.
        Returns:
        the result of get(timeout,timeUnit).
        Throws:
        RuntimeInterruptedException - in place of InterruptedException.
        RuntimeWrappingException - wrapping a thrown ExecutionException or TimeoutException}.
